columns.text:
In this problem, we need to calculate  the total carrying cost, the
restocking cost, and to see if the firm should increase or decrease its order size. Then, we need to  describe an EOQ for the company.
A company begins each week with $450$ phasers in stock. The carrying cost per phaser is $\$34$ per year and the fixed order cost is $\$130$.

Since company has a $450$  phasers in stock at the beginning of each week, the average inventory  is $\frac{450}{2}=225$ units, The carrying cost per phaser is $\$34$ per year, so 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total carrying costs}&=\text{Average inventory}\cdot \text{Carrying cost per unit}\\
&=225\cdot \$34\\
&=\$7,650\\
\end{align*}$$

The company orders stock every week, and the year has $52$ weeks, so the total number of its orders during the year is equal to $52$. Company has the fixed cost per order of $\$130$, so, the total restocking cost for the year are 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total restocking cost}&=\text{Fixed cost per order}\cdot\text{Number of orders}\\
&=\$130\cdot 52\\
&=\$6,760
\end{align*}$$

An optimal inventory policy for the company is 
$$\begin{align*}
EOQ&=\sqrt{\frac{2\cdot \text{Annual Demand}\cdot \text{Fixed Cost to Purchase}}{\text{Carrying Cost per unit}}}\\[15pt]
&=\sqrt{\frac{2\cdot (52\cdot 450)\cdot\$130}{\$34}}\\[15pt]
&=\sqrt{\frac{\$6,084,000}{\$34}}\\[15pt]
&=\sqrt{178,941.176}\\
&\approx423\\
\end{align*}$$
For The Trektronics store, the economic order quantity is $423$ phasers in stock, and we can see that a firm needs to  decrease its inventories for $450-423=27$ units.
